isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CLUTCH CONTROL LINKAGE - 9200, 9300 AND 9400 SERIES - ADJUSTMENTS

important.para: Making the proper internal and external adjustments helps to ensure long clutch life and correct operation of the clutch. ALWAYS adjust the clutch (internal adjustments) before adjusting the linkage (external adjustments). For ALL internal adjustment procedures, refer to GROUP 11 - CLUTCH in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual. Correct linkage (external only) adjustments cannot compensate for incorrect clutch (internal) adjustments.

note.para: SOME OPTIONAL clutches for model 92/93/9400 vehicles are self- adjusting. These clutches are designed to automatically compensate for clutch disc facing wear. However, they require an initial adjustment at either the time of clutch service or clutch linkage service. Refer to GROUP 11 - CLUTCH in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for this adjustment procedure.

step1.para:
Check the height of the clutch pedal; adjust the height if it is not correct. Refer to CLUTCH PEDAL HEIGHT ADJUSTMENT
.

Check the free pedal travel; adjust the length if it is not correct. Refer to FREE PEDAL TRAVEL AND FREE TRAVEL CLEARANCE ADJUSTMENTS.
.

After all the adjustments have been made, test-drive the vehicle. When operating the clutch pedal, check the clutch release and clutch brake operation. The clutch should release fully, and the clutch brake should apply before the clutch pedal contacts the insulator panel.

svcsubproc.title: CLUTCH PEDAL HEIGHT ADJUSTMENT

note.para: For complete internal clutch adjustments, refer to GROUP 11 - CLUTCH in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Operate a (newly installed) clutch a minimum of 4 times to ensure clutch components are fully seated.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Dimension 5 or 6, Figure 3. Check the pedal height. If the pedal height from the insulator panel is not 11.9 inches (302 mm), or from the firewall is not 12.3 inches (312 mm), perform the following steps:

step1.para: For Dimension 6, remove the sound insulator panel from under the pedal. For either dimension 5 or 6, adjust the pedal stop (Item 1, Figure 3) to make the pedal height correct.
If it was removed, install the sound insulator panel.

calloutgroup.callout1: 5. PEDAL HEIGHT, FROM INSULATOR PANEL = 11.9" (302 mm)

svcsubproc.title: FREE PEDAL TRAVEL AND FREE TRAVEL CLEARANCE ADJUSTMENTS
svcsubproc.para: When the pedal height is correct, adjust the free pedal travel and free travel clearance. If EITHER free pedal travel (Dimension 2, Figure 3) is not 2 inches (50.8 mm), OR free travel clearance (Dimension B, Figure 4) is not 1/8 inch (3.2 mm), perform the following procedure to correct BOTH adjustments.
Refer to Figure 4 for the following Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Loosen the control rod lock nut (Item 4, Figure 4).

Remove the cotter pin and clevis pin (Item 2), disconnecting the adjustable clevis (Item 3) of the control rod (Item 5A, 5B or 5C) from the release lever (Item 1 on 5A and 5B), or from the bellcrank (Item 6 on 5C).
Rotate the bellcrank until the release yoke (Item 10) fingers lightly contact the release bearing wear pads (Item 9).

While holding the yoke fingers against the wear pads (per Step 3), turn the adjustable clevis so that you can freely insert the clevis pin through the clevis holes and the lever hole, or the bellcrank hole. Do not install the clevis pin yet.

Lengthen the control rod by turning the clevis 7 turns counterclockwise (viewed from the adjustable end of the control rod), to set the free travel clearance at 1/8 inch (3.2 mm). Tighten the control rod lock nut (Item 4) to 50 - 60 ft-lbs. (68 - 81 N•m).
Install the clevis pin to connect the adjustable clevis with the release lever, or with the bellcrank. Secure it with a new cotter pin.
Check to be certain the free pedal travel is 2 inches (50.8 mm), and the free travel clearance is 1/8 inch (3.2 mm). If the adjustments are not correct, perform Steps 1 through 6 again.
